title: Album Page, "Studies of Two Sailboats, Katwijk aan Zee", August 20, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
markings:
Paper-maker's mark: embossed in sheet at upper left corner:
JMP (inscribed in shield); banner with the name BRISTOL written below.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, at upper right: Katwijk ann Zee / Aug 20th 1887 / Dutch North Sea / K....;  at upper right corner: (inscribed in circle): 13; 14.
description:
Recto of vertical sheet with sketches of two sailboats in shallows.  The boat in the upper half of the sheet has many of its components fully rendered: the masst, boom with wrapped sail, rigging, rudder, wooden hull and dinghy are all identifiable.  The boat's name is written across the side of the ship closest to the bow: IKWEI.  The boat in the lower half of the sheet is rendered in less detail and seems further from the viewer.  It is very similar to the boat above.  A figure stands in the water to the right of the boat.

Verso of sheet has a single sketch of a small rod with holes for adjustment.  This is possibly part of a navigational instrument?

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Studies of Two Sailboats, Katwijk aan Zee", August 20, 1887.
August 20, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-98.
